title: Simulation-Based Training for Transitioning Academic Mathematical Knowledge to Workplace Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Mathematics subject-matter expertise (secondary level or higher) and at least three years of current professional experience
context.additional_context: A training program for current practitioners to enhance mathematical expertise, replicating real job scenarios via simulation/VR environments.

learning_goals: Participants can apply mathematical problem-solving strategies learned in simulation environments to actual tasks with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can identify and explain three or more connections between academic mathematical concepts and workplace practices.
Learners can write a self-reflection report analyzing barriers to learning transfer based on peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
